history.content: Have you followed the steps? https://berkeley.service-now.com/kb_view.do?sysparm_article=KB0012478 also at step 10, you would want to choose your gateway as the library access and full gateway one ----------------- use [library proxy](https://www.lib.berkeley.edu/using-the-libraries/proxy-server), globalprotect really sucks imo

Have you followed the steps? https://berkeley.service-now.com/kb_view.do?sysparm_article=KB0012478
also at step 10, you would want to choose your gateway as the library access and full gateway one

I wanted to download a textbook from Springer (like I used to be able to when I was physically at Berkeley using Berkeley Wifi), but now that I'm remote, I'm not sure how to, since a Berkeley Wifi connection is required to get the textbook for free.

I have a Windows computer and downloaded the "GlobalProtect" software (the first result for "Berkeley VPN" on google), but not sure how to use it. Any tips?
history.subject: VPN
